intro: Psychotria polygrammata, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers, which are often surrounded by velvety, waxy bracts. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a glossy surface and are arranged oppositely along the stems. Psychotria polygrammata is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
